mutations.name: prime_power_factorization
mutations.description: Replace a square‑free conclusion with one asserting that if pᵏ ∣ n (k ≥ 2) then p does not divide the complementary factor, forcing a contradiction with unique factorisation.

mutations.name: radical_squarefree_equiv
mutations.description: Transform the goal `Squarefree n` into `radical n = n` inside ℤ, linking square‑free integers to radicals.

mutations.name: introduce_mobius_sum
mutations.description: Add a statement about the Möbius function μ evaluated on divisors of n squared, forcing cancellation in ∑₍d∣n²₎ μ d.

mutations.name: polynomial_squarefree_lift
mutations.description: Lift an integer square‑free lemma to polynomials by asserting `Squarefree (C n * X + 1)` under suitable n ≠ 0.

mutations.name: squarefree_prime_product_bound
mutations.description: Strengthen results to products of distinct primes p₁⋯pₖ, showing any proper divisor has at most k − 1 prime factors.

mutations.name: minimal_prime_divisor_uniqueness
mutations.description: Assert that the minimal prime dividing a non‑unit square‑free integer appears with exponent exactly one and is unique.

mutations.name: squarefree_power_divisor_bound
mutations.description: Prove that if n is square‑free then every divisor of nᵏ is of the form d·m² with d ∣ n.

mutations.name: gcd_squarefree_cancellation
mutations.description: Introduce a hypothesis `Squarefree n` and conclude `gcd n m = 1 → Squarefree (n * m)`.

mutations.name: unit_associated_normalisation
mutations.description: Replace equalities up to units by explicit `∃ u : Units ℤ, u • x = y`, linking square‑free factors through units.

mutations.name: radical_divides_squarefree_power
mutations.description: State that `radical n ∣ nᵏ` with equality iff n is square‑free, relating radicals to arbitrary powers.

mutations.name: arg_monodromy_loop
mutations.description: Replace an equality with a statement that analytic continuation of arg around a simple closed loop changes by 2π·k, k ≠ 0.

mutations.name: arg_continuous_branch_cut
mutations.description: Add the difficult claim that on a simply‑connected open set avoiding 0 and the negative real axis, arg admits a continuous lift to ℝ.

mutations.name: winding_number_integral
mutations.description: Relate ∮₀¹ (d / dt) arg γ(t) dt to the integer winding number of a closed curve γ not hitting 0.

mutations.name: arg_log_equivalence_branch
mutations.description: Assert that for a chosen branch Log, `arg z = im (Log z)` and deduce uniqueness of branches on star‑shaped domains.

mutations.name: arg_conformal_map_invariance
mutations.description: State that for a conformal f with f(0) ≠ 0 the increment of arg along f∘γ equals that of γ, modulo its winding number.

mutations.name: arg_maximum_principle_variant
mutations.description: Strengthen an arg bound to show that if arg of a holomorphic function attains a local interior extremum then the function is constant.

mutations.name: arg_triangle_strict
mutations.description: Upgrade `|arg(z w) − arg z − arg w| ≤ π` to a strict inequality with ε > 0 under non‑collinearity conditions.

mutations.name: arg_branch_derivative
mutations.description: Introduce the claim that the derivative of a smooth branch of arg equals `Im (z⁻¹)` on its domain.

mutations.name: arg_winding_number_path_lift
mutations.description: Assert the existence of a continuous lift of arg to ℝ along any path avoiding 0 and relate its endpoints to winding number.

mutations.name: arg_monotone_homotopy
mutations.description: Given a homotopy H between two loops avoiding 0, prove their arg increments differ by 2πk with the same k.

Mathlib.Analysis.Complex.Arg.strip_zero_cases: Eliminates the trivial zero-terms from an equivalence by adding hypotheses x≠0 and y≠0, thereby isolating the non-trivial branch.
Mathlib.Analysis.Complex.Arg.common_scalar_rescale: Multiply every occurrence of the variables by one arbitrary non-zero scalar, exploiting the homogeneity of the norms and arguments.

mutations.name: strong_limit_power_bound
mutations.description: Replace κ⁺ < 2^κ with the harder ≤ bound for strong‑limit cardinals and discuss failure under SCH.

mutations.name: beth_fixed_point_existence
mutations.description: State that for every κ there exists λ > κ with beth_λ = λ, yielding fixed points of the beth hierarchy.

mutations.name: singular_strong_limit_exponent
mutations.description: Claim that if κ is singular strong‑limit then 2^κ = κ⁺⁺ under GCH and investigate consistency otherwise.

mutations.name: pcf_theoretic_bound
mutations.description: Introduce the pcf‑bound `κ^{cf κ} < maxpcf(κ)` for regular κ and relate it to Shelah's Strong Hypothesis.

mutations.name: silver_dichotomy_colouring
mutations.description: State a variant of Silver's theorem showing that any colouring of [κ]² into < cf κ colours has a homogeneous set of size κ.

mutations.name: eastons_function_extension
mutations.description: Assert that a given normal monotone Easton function on regulars extends to the full power‑set function consistently.

mutations.name: stationary_set_reflection_bound
mutations.description: Relate failure of stationary reflection at κ to lower bounds on 2^κ, yielding inequalities beyond GCH.

mutations.name: square_principle_cardinality
mutations.description: Assuming ◻_κ, derive a strict inequality between κ⁺ and the least cardinal λ with a special Aronszajn tree.

mutations.name: cofinality_splitting_number
mutations.description: Introduce the splitting number s_κ and relate κ < s_κ ≤ 2^κ, yielding new lower bounds on 2^κ.

mutations.name: singular_cub_filter_bound
mutations.description: Show that the existence of a CUB‑filter on κ^{++} for singular κ forces 2^κ ≥ κ^{+ω}.

mutations.name: eigenvalue_interlace_principle
mutations.description: Replace a basic eigenvalue bound with the full Cauchy interlacing inequalities for principal submatrices.

mutations.name: weyl_inequality_sum
mutations.description: Strengthen a trace equality to Weyl's inequalities relating eigenvalues of A, B, A + B.

mutations.name: courant_fischer_minmax
mutations.description: Introduce the min–max characterisation of kth eigenvalues via subspace optimisation problems.

mutations.name: loewner_order_transitivity
mutations.description: Assert that if 0 ≤ A ≤ B and 0 ≤ B ≤ C then A ≤ C, with equality characterisation via kernels.

mutations.name: spectral_radius_norm_bound
mutations.description: Relate spectral radius ρ(A) to operator norm ∥A∥ and give strict inequality for indefinite A.

mutations.name: trace_log_det_inequality
mutations.description: State the Golden‑Thompson–type inequality tr exp(A + B) ≤ tr exp A exp B for symmetric A,B.

mutations.name: psd_sequence_convergence
mutations.description: Introduce monotone convergence of quadratic forms xᵀAₙx ↑ xᵀAx implying strong operator convergence.

mutations.name: symmetric_congruence_invariance
mutations.description: Assert that A ≅ B via PᵀAP = B preserves inertia and eigenvalue multiplicities.

mutations.name: determinant_lower_bound_psd
mutations.description: Strengthen determinant equality to Hadamard‑type lower bounds det A ≥ ∏ diag Aᵢᵢ for PSD A.

mutations.name: matrix_function_calculus
mutations.description: Replace an equality with a statement that a polynomial p satisfies p(A) ≥ 0 for all eigenvalues λᵢ ≥ 0.
